frames.text: Venture out onto the road and start the game?

options.prefix: A gentle breeze blows. You feel refreshed and full of enthusiasm for the day ahead.

frames.text: You are standing on the main road, at the bottom of the track which leads to your house. There are two ways to travel to Athens: go North, around Mount Hymettos, or take the Southern road beneath the mountain.
You trudge along the dusty road for a while. Now you're passing the fields where you keep some of your beehives. Mount Hymettos looms to the South.
frames.text2: You are on the road between your village and Athens. Mount Hymettos looms to the South. Your beehives are in a field nearby.

options.text: Take a detour to inspect your beehives
Follow the road East, towards your village

frames.text: The road winds out of the mountains from the East. Athens can be seen in the distance, to the West.

options.text: Head back East, towards your village

frames.text: Bees buzz softly among the flowers in the field where your beehives are kept. The hives are lined up in a row.
You open up each hive in turn. The bees haven't produced much honey lately, but there's enough to fill a clay pot.
You already took all the honey that was ready. The bees need time to make some more.
The road between your village and Athens winds slowly beneath Mount Hymettos' southern slopes. As you trudge along the stony path towards Athens, a gleam underfoot catches your eye.
frames.text2: The road between your village and Athens winds slowly beneath Mount Hymettos' southern slopes.

frames.text: It's a coin - a hemiobol, in fact. You tuck it in your pouch

As you walk along the road, you cross a broad valley with olive trees scattered across it. A tiny tavern stands in the middle of the valley, close to the road. A sign outside advertises wine and olive oil for sale.
frames.text2: You are on the road outside a tavern in a broad valley.

frames.text: The road slopes downhill as it approaches Athens. The city's outer edges are just about visible on the southwestern horizon. To the south, you see a little track, barely distinguishable among the rocks. It leads up a steep slope towards what looks like a cave.

options.text: Climb the track to the cave
Follow the road back towards your village

frames.text: You find yourself in a small tavern with a brick floor. It's dark. The innkeeper is stacking plates behind the wooden table which serves as a bar. The tavern is empty, apart from three old men in the far corner, hunched around a table, chewing on bread and olives and conversing quietly.
frames.text2: You are in a small tavern. The innkeeper is resting on a stool behind the bar. Three old men sit in the corner, eating breakfast.

frames.text: 'Good morning, traveller! On your way to Athens, perhaps? What can I get you? We have bread, oil... and wine of course, but it's a little early for wine, ho ho ho!'
frames.text2: 'Well then, traveller. What would you like?'

options.text: 'Don't shame me for my bad decisions. Give me wine!'

frames.text: 'Wine it is, then! One glass coming right up.'
'You're in luck, my daughters just finished baking this morning. Here's a delicious fresh loaf just for you.
frames.text2: Here you are, one loaf of fresh bread.'

frames.text: 'Hm, well, I can't sell you that if you don't have the coin.'
The three old men have knapsacks under their stools and good boots on their feet. Magnificently sturdy walking sticks are propped against the table. The old men chew bread and talk across each other.
frames.text2: The three old men have finished their meal and are having a little snooze. It doesn't look like they want to be disturbed.

frames.text: 'Hey, what are you doing there, standing about? On your way to Athens too?'

options.prefix: 'If you don't want to talk, get away from our table!'
'Ah, we're all from the same tribe, then!'

frames.text: 'Good morning to you as well - a fellow traveller, it seems! Where have you come from?'

options.prefix: 'Harumph, and there we were thinking you wanted to chat.'
'Ah, we're all from the same tribe, then!'
'Hohoho! We have a joker here who knows his Homer! I hope we don't look like cyclopses...'

frames.text: All three old men turn their backs on you.
'We're from Thorokos. We're heading to Athens, but we stopped for breakfast.

options.text: I'm surprised you got this far on those old legs.'
'You've covered a great distance - you must have set out early!'
options.prefix: 'Oh, we got up at the crack of dawn! You can't keep these old men in bed. We all have important things to do in Athens.'

frames.text: 'Conon needs to find his drunken no-good son and drag him back home. Diogiton is in for his monthly fix of fishcakes. I myself just wanted an excuse to get away from my wife! But we're all really interested in is finding out the latest news on Philip of Macedon.'
frames.text2: 'What do you want to know, fellow-traveller?'

options.text: 'It was good to meet you. Good luck on your journey.'

frames.text: 'You're not such a whippersnapper yourself, but you should still have respect for your elders!'

options.text: 'Old men can't take a joke these days.'
options.prefix: 'We have no interest in talking to a disrespectful turnip-face.'

frames.text: 'Hrmmm...'

options.text: 'So, why are you heading to Athens?'

frames.text: You have reached Athens!
